channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Tens of thousands of protesters support Bolsonaro ahead of coup trial verdict
item.description: In Brazil, tens of thousands of protesters mobilized across the country to support former President Jair Bolsonaro ahead of the verdict in his landmark coup trial.

item.title: Law professor talks about Trump's plan to send National Guard to Chicago
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with University of Chicago law professor Craig Futterman about President Trump's plans to send National Guard troops to the Windy City.

item.title: Trump dials back threats to Chicago, but says he still plans to send National Guard
item.description: President Trump is dialing back his threats to Chicago, after posting on social media that the city is "about to find out why it's called the Department of WAR." But tensions are still high.

item.title: What kind of dairy does a body good? Science is updating the answer
item.description: New dietary guidelines are coming soon. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has promised the days of skim milk and other low-fat dairy products are over. Is there a case for more fat in dairy?

item.title: Trial begins for man charged with attempting to assassinate Trump
item.description: Ryan Routh was arrested after a Secret Service agent spotted him holding a gun and fired on him when Trump was golfing at his West Palm Beach golf club in September. He faces up to life in prison.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump remains steadfast on sending National Guard to Chicago, but dials back threats, man charged in Trump assassination attempt goes on trial, Russia launches largest airstrike on Ukraine.

item.title: Get your tastebuds ready for fall with a recipe that's packed with flavor and color
item.description: How white beans, chorizo and some olive oil can smooth out an awkward transition from summer to fall.

item.title: French government on brink of collapse ahead of confidence vote on budget
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron may soon be on the hunt for a new prime minister, the country's fifth since he took office, after a confidence vote the current PM is expected to lose.

item.title: 'I don't want them to think they won': U.S. citizen says masked officers stopped her
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin has the story of a U.S. citizen who says she was questioned by masked officers who did not identify themselves.

item.title: Israel cracks down even further on incoming aid to Gaza
item.description: Israel is increasing restrictions on aid to Gaza, as aid organizations call on the country to flood Gaza with food and medicine to avert further catastrophe.
